Apple Planning To Include iPhone 17 Air In 2025 Lineup, May Be Thinnest iPhone Ever - NDTV Profit
summary:
Apple Planning To Include iPhone 17 Air In 2025 Lineup, May Be Thinnest iPhone Ever

Date: 13 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit Tech

The Apple iPhone 17 Air is set to be unveiled in 2025 and is expected to be the company’s thinnest iPhone to date, potentially including Apple's first in-house modem.

  • The iPhone 17 Air may be approximately 6.25 mm thick, making it thinner than both the iPhone 16 Pro and the iPhone 6.
  • It is anticipated to feature Apple's first in-house 5G modem to enhance performance without compromising device features.
  • The device may include a 6.6-inch ProMotion OLED display with a 120 Hz refresh rate.
  • Speculated camera features include a 48-megapixel rear camera and a 24-megapixel front camera.
  • It may be powered by the A19 chip and come with 8GB of RAM.
Mark Gurman states that reaching this level of thinness will pave the way for Apple’s upcoming foldable gadgets.

In conclusion, the iPhone 17 Air represents Apple's commitment to innovation in their device lineup, focusing on design and technology integration.
newTitle: Apple Planning To Include iPhone 17 Air In 2025 Lineup, May Be Thinnest iPhone Ever

title: JVC marks India comeback with Google TV-based QLED TV range: Details here - Business Standard
summary:
JVC marks India comeback with Google TV-based QLED TV range: Details here

Publication Date: January 2023
Source: [Source Name]

JVC (Japan Victor Company) has made its return to the Indian market with a new range of Made in India smart QLED televisions, set to launch on Amazon India during the Republic Day Sale from January 14. The TVs are available in seven different sizes, starting at Rs 11,999.

Key features include:

  • Seven display sizes ranging from 32-inch to 75-inch.
  • Up to 4K UHD resolution with HDR10 support.
  • Audio with Dolby Atmos and up to 80W output.
  • Built-in Google TV platform with popular streaming app access.
  • Connectivity options including HDMI, USB, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth.
“India is one of the fastest-growing markets in the world, and we believe our innovative, high-quality products will resonate with local consumers,” said Pallavi Singh, country representative, JVC TV India.

JVC aims to achieve ₹500 crores in revenue over the next three years, emphasizing innovation and consumer engagement.
newTitle: JVC Returns to India with New Google TV QLED Range

Xiaomi Pad 7’s purple patch emerges from an unconventional generational transition - Hindustan Times
summary:
Xiaomi Pad 7 Review: A New Contender in the Tablet Market

Publication Date: October 13, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Xiaomi Pad 7 aims to build upon the success of its predecessor, the Pad 6, with aggressive pricing and improved features. This article reviews its performance, pricing options, and competition in the market.

  • The Pad 7 is priced starting at ₹26,999 for the 8GB+128GB variant, and ₹29,999 for the 12GB+256GB option.
  • A unique nano-texture display option is available at ₹31,999, potentially reducing glare.
  • The Pad 7 features an 11.2-inch display, upgraded from 11 inches in Pad 6, with a new aspect ratio of 3:2.
  • It utilizes a Snapdragon 7+ Gen3 processor, which performs well despite being a lower spec chip compared to its predecessor's Snapdragon 870.
  • Battery life is impressive, lasting days on a single charge with an 8850mAh battery.
"The Xiaomi Pad 7 as a tablet is almost perfect... worth your time and money."

In conclusion, while the Xiaomi Pad 7 excels as a standalone tablet, some inconsistencies with the keyboard's touchpad detract from its overall appeal as a multifunctional device. Improvements in future software updates may address these concerns.
newTitle: Xiaomi Pad 7 Review: A New Contender in the Tablet Market

title: Redmi 14C 5G review in 10 points - India Today
summary:
Redmi 14C 5G Review in 10 Points

Publication Date: January 6, 2025 | Source: India Today

Xiaomi’s sub-brand Redmi has launched the Redmi 14C 5G, refreshing its budget-friendly C series with a significant design overhaul and impressive features.

  • The Redmi 14C features a 6.88-inch display with a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • It is powered by a Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 chipset and runs on HyperOS 14 based on Android 14.
  • The phone delivers satisfactory performance with minimal heating during charging.
  • Battery capacity is 5,600mAh, lasting easily throughout the day.
  • Charging is supported at 18W, which is relatively slow, taking about 1.5 hours to fully charge.
  • Camera setup includes a 50-megapixel primary camera and a 2-megapixel secondary sensor.
  • Selfies are decent but may lack sharpness, suitable for social media.
  • The starting price is Rs 9,999, offering significant value in its category.
"The Redmi 14C 5G offers great value for its price range."

In conclusion, the Redmi 14C 5G is a competitively priced smartphone that excels in design and battery life while providing satisfactory performance for budget-conscious consumers.

summary:
Apple's iPhone 17 Air Might Be Even Thinner Than Previously Expected

Publication Date: 12 October 2023 | Source: Gadgets 360

Apple is set to release the iPhone 17 series, which may include an ultra-thin iPhone 17 Air model, expected to measure around 5.5mm in thickness. This new model is designed to replace the 'Plus' version, being the slimmest iPhone to date.

  • The iPhone 17 Air will reportedly lack a physical SIM card slot, relying solely on eSIM technology.
  • An analyst predicts that the thickness will surpass the iPhone 6's 6.9mm.
  • The device is expected to feature a premium price between $1,299 and $1,500.
  • It may include an A18 or A19 chip with 8GB RAM and new 5G and Wi-Fi chips.
  • Display features include a 6.6-inch OLED with 120Hz ProMotion refresh rate and improved scratch resistance.
“If Kuo's claims about 5.5mm thickness come true, the iPhone 17 Air will be the thinnest iPhone ever built.”

The iPhone 17 Air is generating excitement for its potential innovative features and design advancements.

The article discusses the impressive financial results of Sharma East India for the month of December 2024, highlighting a significant increase in net sales and profit compared to the previous year.

  • Net Sales reached Rs 8.15 crore, marking a 39.35% increase from Rs 5.85 crore in December 2023.
  • Quarterly Net Profit was reported at Rs 0.29 crore, up 22.53% from Rs 0.23 crore in the same period last year.
  • EBITDA increased to Rs 0.90 crore, reflecting a growth of 1.12% from Rs 0.89 crore in December 2023.

title: Apple users, beware of Banshee Stealer: Malware targeting macOS devices - India Today
summary:
Apple users, beware of Banshee Stealer: Malware targeting macOS devices

Published On: Jan 13, 2025

Source: Nandini Yadav

The Banshee Stealer malware has resurfaced, targeting macOS devices and stealing sensitive information such as browser credentials and passwords.

  • The malware targets macOS users and can extract critical data while remaining undetected.
  • It first emerged in mid-2024, being offered as a “stealer-as-a-service” to cybercriminals.
  • On September 2024, an updated version was found which evaded antivirus systems.
  • Distributed through phishing websites and fake repositories, disguising itself as legitimate software.
  • Experts warn users to reassess their security practices and take proactive measures.
“This stealthy malware doesn’t just infiltrate; it operates undetected, blending seamlessly with normal system processes while stealing browser credentials...” - Check Point Research

Banshee Stealer highlights the need for increased vigilance among macOS users as cyber threats continue to evolve.
newTitle: Apple users, beware of Banshee Stealer: Malware targeting macOS devices
